single_crochet copyright melanie grobler m and m crochet designs pg 7 round 18 *inv decrease*repeat * * 5 more times 6 single_crochet cut yarn leaving a 70 cm tail use a sewing needle to sew through stalk make one for each pumpkin i made one using colour brown make a magic_ring helpful hint if you are working in velvet/plush yarn you can replace the magic_ring by chaining 3 slip stitch into 1st chain then continue round 1 helpful hint we are working in the round round 1 chain 1 does not count as a st single_crochet 4 into mc place st marker in 4th single_crochet and continue to work in the round 4 single_crochet round 2 *single_crochet 2 into next st* repeat * * 3 more times 8 single_crochet round 3 blo single_crochet into blo of next 8 sts 8 blo single_crochet rounds 4 6 single_crochet into next 8 sts 8 single_crochet at the end of round 6 cut yarn leaving a 20 cm tail use sewing needle sew through the flo of each st pull tight and leave remaining tail helpful hint we will use the remaining tail to attach the stalk to the pumpkin later in the pattern copyright melanie grobler m and m crochet designs pg 9 vine make one or two for each pumpkin i made one using colour green chain 16 row 1 single_crochet 3 into 2nd chain from hook single_crochet 3 into 14 chs 45 single_crochet cut yarn leaving a 20 cm tail helpful hint we will use the tail to attach the vine to the pumpkin later in the pattern copyright melanie grobler m and m crochet designs pg 10 finishing the pumpkin using the tail end from the pumpkin stitch around the pumpkin in 6 sections going through the middle of the pumpkin each time and pull tight to make the segments of a pumpkin sew the stalk to the centre of the pumpkin repeat with the vine weave in ends copyright melanie grobler m and m crochet
